name: Matilda
case: Executive Commitee and Rustfire Serial Event
info: Matilda's pistol has 10 bullets. Each Normal Attack consumes 1 bullet. When she is out of bullets, it takes 2 seconds to reload.
criminalRecord:
As a member of Family Cavendish in Eastside, she once served on the Executive Committee as Donald's adjutant. After the West District riot, she didn't return to Eastside and was therefore seen as a family outcast by those around her. In reality, she was a secret supporter of Rustfire.

--

The subject received an elite education in Eastside from a young age, but her experiences in the West District changed her value on this world. After going through the hearing with Chief, she refused the assistant position offered by her aunt and chose to stay at the MBCC.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
She has an excellent grasp of firearms, being able to use any gun proficiently as soon as she gets her hands on it. Not only that, she can use different firearms to adapt to different combat situations.

+++* Awakening Signs
During her duty in N.F. 112, she was contaminated and awakened as a Sinners, seen as a disgrace that needed to be covered up by her family.

+++* Corruption State
The subject has very high moral standards, a stable mind, and a low degree of corruption.
ecbFlavourText:
"Don‚Äôt overthink. Just aim. Yes. Just aim..."
"After all... apart from shooting, I'm not good at anything else."
arrestRec1: After the Rustfire serial events, the subject joined the MBCC almost as if she was transferred there. Investigations revealed that she concealed her Sinner identity during her tenure at the Executive Committee. Now, the MBCC detains her as a Sinner. During her detention, the subject has not tried to resist in any way.
arrestRec2: The subject's full name is Matilda Cavendish, and her aunt is the star councilor of Eastside, Bernadette Cavendish. After the West District incident, the subject was invited to the hearing to speak for the people of West District.
arrestRec3: The subject's parents died in the Abel assassination turmoil, and she was adopted by her aunt. During their time together, her aunt sent her to the best elite school in Eastside, but she struggled academically and suffered a lot of stress. All those times, she regarded her aunt as a role model in life.
arrestRec4: After graduation, the subject started working at the Executive Committee and noticed that the real situation in the West District was nothing like what she learned in Eastside, and her perspective started to change. At the hearing for the West District incident, the subject firmly advocated for cooperation between West District and Eastside. After Family Cavendish decided to support her, the situation in Eastside changed.
servingTerm1: After being transferred to the MBCC, the subject voluntarily took on many tasks within the Bureau, completing them all with high efficiency and flying colors. However, due to her overly serious nature, the subject has a distant relationship with most Sinners and is not good at communication.

supervision1:
++* ‚ö† Emulating Role Model

//Lately, [[[Nightingale|Nightingale's]]] been getting a real migraine from Matilda.//

**System Notifications:** Matilda really looks up to Nightingale and wants to grab the chance to learn from her role model after she got into the Bureau. Admirable, for sure, but Nightingale quickly catches on that Matilda is tracking everything down to the tiny detail, like whether Nightingale leads with her left or right foot when stepping out the door.

* **Prompt:** Just let her be...

**Chief:** Just let her learn. If she picks up even just ninety percent of what you know, that's a win for all of us.
supervision2:
++* ‚ö† Neat Freak

//At times, a penchant for cleanliness is a godsend for roommates.//

**System Notifications:** You might've seen how spotless the training room's been lately. Well, turns out, it's all thanks to Matilda's need for neatness. She couldn't handle the messy ways of some Sinners and decided to just straighten things out herself.

* **Prompt:** That explains why no one's had to do cleanup duty for ages.
supervision3:
++* ‚ö† The Echoes of Intensity

//Sometimes, Matilda is on edge, her nerves stretched to their limit.//

**System Notifications:** Matilda was on her toes about every little thing she did when she first got into the Bureau. She was so strung out that one day, when you spotted her snoozing under a tree and went to tell her she might catch a chill, she popped up with a "Sorry, Aunt Bernadette!" without missing a beat.

* **Prompt:** Uh, it's okay?
supervision4:
++* ‚ö†‚ö† Plan Hacker

//Matilda is all about sticking rigidly to her schedule.//

**System Notifications:** Now, monthly update on Sinner Matilda's whereabouts: Recreation Area visits, zero; Outdoor Activity Area visits, zero...

**Chief:** She's stretched way too thin... Sure, she's a perfectionist, but remember, even a spring snaps if it's always wound tight. This isn't sustainable...

**System Notifications:** You've made multiple attempts to get Matilda to ease up, suggesting breaks now and then, but it's like talking to a wall. Whether it's going to see a movie or grabbing some coffee, she's always got an excuse, "Sorry, I'm booked then."

* **Prompt:** Request for help

**Chief:** ...That's the situation. She's all about pre-planned routines and strict adherence. Getting her to pencil in some fun time is a real challenge, and nudging her to switch up her plans on the fly? Near impossible. [[[Tetra]]], got any ideas on how to tackle this?

**Tetra:** Huh... So, you're telling me our job is to swipe some time off the calendar of Miss Perfect Planner? Sounds like a fun little challenge. Let's have a look...

**Chief:** Exactly. Wait, you're already on your phone? Cooking up a scheme to convince Matilda, are you?

**Tetra:** Hmph, obviously. I've got the elite's mindset down to a science. Hit them where it hurts, and you'll see instant results. Anyway, she'll be there for tea with you tomorrow. Just you wait.

**System Notifications:** Try as you might to pry into the details of the convincing, Tetra always says a phantom thief's methods are off-limits to you, but she's sure it'll work. So there you are, half-doubting, half-hoping, in the greenhouse, waiting for some kind of magic to happen.

**Matilda:** Directly ahead, about 15 meters from the door, there's a table with tea and treats... Chief, you got here early too?

* **Prompt:** Surprised and confused

**Chief:** Matilda, you really showed up. Did Tetra say something to you?

**Matilda:** Miss Tetra? Nope, not her. Why would you say that? I'm only here because it was penciled in my planner.

**Chief:** ...Ah, I see now, you're on the default calendar app. Tetra probably hacked in and made some changes... Oops, I mean, afternoon tea wasn't in your original plans, was it? Didn't anything seem off to you?

**Matilda:** Uh, I don't actually remember adding this to my schedule, but maybe it's just a memory slip... In any case, it's best to stick to what's officially on the books.

**Chief:** It's, uh, good to be thorough. Matilda, why don't we start with a cup of tea... and after we finish the cake, we can chat about the importance of info security.
supervision5:
++* ‚ö†‚ö† Undercover Glamour

//The Eastside Beauty Pageant has become a target for criminals.//

**Matilda:** Hey, cut it out. I'm lost here... I'm playing along because this is part of a Public Security Bureau case, but if you don't drop this act, I'm going straight to Chief!

**[[[Cassia]]]:** Even if you're not sure about your looks, at least believe in my nose... I'm spot on when it comes to recognizing beauty. The scent you carry... Ah, it's absolutely captivating...

* **Prompt:** Rush off

**Chief:** It sounds like... Cassia and Matilda? Is there trouble brewing? Just hang on, no need to get heated, I'm coming right now!

**Matilda:** Chief, you're here. This lady, for some reasons, has been going overboard complimenting my looks and even trying to snag some of my hair.

**Matilda:** The fishy stuff includes her calling me a top-notch beauty and saying she can sniff out a "crisp, deep" scent on me. I let her know that I'm not one to fall for fake compliments, and yet she keeps at it.

**Chief:** ...

**Matilda:** She's even spinning a yarn about the Eastside beauty pageant being targeted by crooks. Claims you've tasked her with picking out Sinners for an undercover gig there.

**Matilda:** I've gone through her stuff using the Bureau's guide on suspicious characters and everything's clean, no risks. Right now, I'm just trying to stay one step ahead of her. If you give the word that this is all fake, I can cuff her on the spot.

* **Prompt:** M-Matilda? Is that you for real? What's with the... outfit?

**Matilda:** This dress? Yeah, that lady over there insisted I put it on, claiming "facts speak louder than words." But honestly, I'm not comfortable in it and don't quite get her drift. Chief, why the shocked face?

**Chief:** No, no, it's nothing. Just struck by how good Cassia is at picking the right people... If you're game to hit the contest in that outfit, we won't need to scout anyone else. You'll knock them dead, for sure.

**Matilda:** If it really helps crack the case, then yeah, I won't say no. But what's the deal here...? Is she not lying to me after all...?

**Cassia:** Heh, after seeing how Chief's jaw dropped, you gotta believe me now... You might be clueless about your looks, but my nose knows the truth... Can I have my hair sample now?

**Chief:** Right on, right on. Matilda, you ought to believe in yourself, you're looking stunning in that dress‚Äîbut let's skip the hair part.
supervision6:
++* ‚ö†‚ö†‚ö† Water Gun Fight

//To be or not to be a gun, that's the question with water guns.//

**System Notifications:** Noise in the Outdoor Activity Area's hit the red zone. Please check for any unusual activity and deal with it ASAP.

* **Prompt:** Check surveillance

**Chief:** Figured as much, it's the pool party crew... Sure, they earned their day of fun for playing nice, but why the need to be so noisy?

**System Notifications:** Seeing as the Sinners have been on their best behavior for two weeks straight just for this bit of excitement, you're not about to call it off for a bit of racket. Instead, you choose to go there yourself and ask them to tone it down a notch.

**Chief:** Hey, is that Matilda? Why are you all by yourself with a water gun? Not a fan of water fights?

**Matilda:** Chief? Good to see you. Water fights... you mean, like, spraying each other with toys and stuff? I'm kind of new to this. Just trying to work out the rules by watching from the sidelines.

**Chief:** Water fights are all about having fun, no real rules. But hey, the more you drench others, the better player you are, I guess. With that water gun in your hands, you're already ahead of the game compared to those just using their hands.

**Matilda:** To be honest... I'm not sure I'm up for using it. If you'd like, you can have it.

* **Prompt:** Puzzled

**Chief:** What's up with this water gun? I asked [[[Eureka]]] and [[[Mess]]] to give it a once-over. They've dialed down the power, so it's all safe and fun‚Äîno one gets hurt.

**Matilda:** Nope, that's not it. You're aware of my special power, right? If we're classifying water guns as firearms, wouldn't me joining the water fight be kinda unfair to the other Sinners?

* **Prompt:** Water guns aren't really guns.
 * **Chief:** The one we picked up is super basic, really different from what you'd call a regular gun.
 * **Matilda:** Got it. Well, if that's how it is, I better keep watching for a while longer. Need to figure out everyone else's moves to clinch this win...
 * **Chief:** ...Really, Matilda? Does winning this water fight matter so much to you?
 * **Matilda:** Absolutely. There's no fun in losing. That's been my dilemma‚Äîshould I use my sharpshooting edge to cut down everyone else's shot at winning?
 * **Chief:** But, you know, I think... there aren't really winners in a water fight. Isn't it about who has the most fun? The one having the most fun is closest to winning, I guess. Maybe taking that approach makes it less stressful!
 * **Matilda:** The one having the most fun is closest to winning...? That explains why even the drenched ones are all grins and giggles...

* **Prompt:** It's okay if water guns are guns.
 * **Chief:** You do have an edge on using guns, but in a water fight, it's all about playing to your strengths, right? So, no big deal.
 * **Chief:** You know, you could take it easy, or forget the water gun and just play with splashes... There's more than one way to play!
 * **Matilda:** But holding back... wouldn't that be like not giving the game and everyone else the respect they deserve?
 * **Matilda:** If I had a say, I'd definitely refuse to play a game if my opponent suggests giving me an advantage, like playing with one hand tied. It feels awful to be treated with kid gloves just because you're seen as the weak one. I've been there; I know what it's like.
 * **Chief:** Y-you're making sense. What's your move then?
 * **Matilda:** I'm bringing this gun along. I believe in respecting my rival by going all out to win. Chief, please look forward to my performance in the battle! Here I go!
 * **Chief:** Who knew Matilda would get so intense over a game... It's probably just her way of being tough on herself...
baseVoicelines:
[Obtain the Sinner]
Isn't this supposed to be a transfer? What's the meaning of this? Sinner... detainment?! Chief, please clarify this! What have I done wrong?

[Raise to Phase 1]
Thank you for the promotion. I'll work even harder from now on.

[Raise to Phase 3]
This may be the limit of my power right now. In any case, thank you for your trust and support.

[Level Start]
I will provide fire support for the team.

[Win Battles]
The video recording is complete. It will be archived so you can review the gains and setbacks of this battle at your convenience.

[Lose Battles]
Keep shooting, cover Chief's retreat!

[Ultimate Skill]
Suppressing fire!

[Die in Battles]
Hold the line... Don't worry... about me...

[Greeting]
Hello, Chief. I've finished sorting out today's files. Most are regular purchase requisitions and operation reports. You can just skim through them. There are also several classified files from the higher-ups, which I've singled out for you. You may need to address those at your earliest convenience.

[Conversation 1]
"Don't pass up any opportunity  to prepare before things really start." This is what my mother taught me, and it helped me through many difficult situations.

[Conversation 2]
I'm humbled every time I see Ms. Nightingale work. You are indeed fortunate to have the support of such a reliable adjutant.

[Conversation 3]
"The ten ring is only the limit for the target, not mine." I know, it's a bold claim, umm... quite out of my usual character. But when it comes to shooting, I have that level of confidence.

[Special Conversation 1]
The Executive Committee does have many problems, such as management deficiencies and disorganized staff. It's practically a miracle that it still functions... but I still learned a lot from it. I hope these experiences will help the MBCC's work.

[Special Conversation 2]
A tidy work environment is good for physical and mental health. If possible, I hope you can clean your office regularly... I understand that you're busy with work. You can ask me to do it.

[Special Conversation 3]
Please try to have a healthy schedule and rest on time. Leave what you can't finish to your subordinates. Don't push yourself too hard. After all... your health is critical to the proper functioning of the entire Bureau.

[Full Compliance]
When I faced those glamorous elites in the past, I doubted the worth of my own efforts. But not anymore. I don't need to compare myself to them. Ms. Nightingale, Donald, and everyone at the MBCC made me realize it's okay to just be myself. Thank you guys, and thank you Chief.

[Idle]
Want some coffee? I ground the beans myself. The beans are from my home... I mean, from Eastside. It tastes wonderful and doesn't have that bitter aftertaste. Are you sure you don't want a cup?

[Annoyed]
Please stop this behavior right now!

[Special Attention]
Sinner Matilda, code MBCC-S-745, reporting for duty. Please issue your commands.

[Dispatch]
The time required for the mission is estimated to be 8-24 hours, and I will keep you informed of the progress in real time.

[Dispatch Complete]
I will submit the mission report to the administrative office later.Please take a look.

[Level Up]
Stronger power entails heavier responsibility.
shortSummary: Physical normal attack based Sinner with ramping Attack Speed and a 2 core DMG ult.

New exclusive Ultimate [Full Firepower].
Matilda immediately reloads all bullets and enters Rapid Fire Mode. In this state, bullets are reloaded instantly, the Normal Attack Damage is reduced by 35% / 30% / 25%, and each Normal Attack can fire 3 / 4 / 5 bullets in a row. This effect lasts 12 seconds.
[Full Firepower] can only be used once per battle.

servingTerm2: The subject often goes to the shooting range for practice, using various firearms with a poker face and indifferent demeanor, leading some Sinners to mistakenly perceive her as a difficult person. However, in reality, the subject will immediately apologize sincerely if she realizes that her gunfire has disturbed others.
servingTerm3: As she spends more time at the MBCC, the subject is accepted by more and more Sinners, and some Sinners begin to enjoy teasing her and watching her funny reactions.
servingTerm4: The subject often works overtime until late at night, and she has repeatedly publicly stated that she wants to be like Nightingale, a reliable adjutant at Chief's side.
